manifest_description: Authoritative source of truth for EFL meso/macro block declarations. Maps block_id → internal intent, constraints, assessment gates, exit conditions. Does NOT contain exercises, reps, or loads—only declarative intent. Legality computed first; session ceilings are not targets.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Own positions under load and low elasticity. Build movement quality before force production.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Low elastic

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Acceleration mechanics only. No max-velocity exposure. Distance: 100–200m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Operating range; not a target. Stay toward lower end for quality.

sprint_meters_range.note: TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax). Intensity below threshold zeros the meter count.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Bilateral strength + landing mechanics
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Unilateral strength + accel mechanics

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Low–Moderate
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: No reactive shock. Emphasis on symmetry, decel, stiffness at low amplitude.
macro_structure.notes: Foundation block. Stay below ceilings. Accumulate quality exposures.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Increase force output while maintaining control. Volume rises before intensity.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Elastic base

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Acceleration + short build-up (≤20m). Distance: 200–350m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Operating range; not a target.

sprint_meters_range.note: TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax). Intensity below threshold zeros the meter count.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Bilateral force + short accel (≤20m)
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Unilateral force + med-ball / elastic prep

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Still E1–E2 only. Elastic work minimal; focus on force base.
macro_structure.notes: Volume rises, intensity stays controlled. Gate check at Week 4.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Convert strength into usable athletic output. Begin elastic integration.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Speed–Strength
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Elastic

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Build-up speed + controlled max-V exposure (low volume). Distance: 300–500m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Operating range; not a target.

sprint_meters_range.note: TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax). Intensity below threshold zeros the meter count.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Contrast strength + low-amplitude elastic
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Acceleration → build-up speed (≤30m)

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate–High
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Still no Tier 3. Elastic work remains sub-max. Rhythm and coordination intro.
macro_structure.notes: Secondary MDP bias (JUMP/SPEED/COD) becomes active in routing at Week 7. Gate check at Week 8.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Solidify speed, coordination, and rhythm without peaking. Prepare for pre-season pivot.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Speed–Strength
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Elastic rhythm

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Max-velocity controlled (high-quality, low-volume transition). Prep for unrestricted in pre-season. Distance: 400–600m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Operating range; not a target. Creep toward pre-season entry (80–120).

sprint_meters_range.note: TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax). Intensity below threshold zeros the meter count.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Speed emphasis + low-volume strength
cns_per_day.day_B_description: COD rhythm + elastic sequencing

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but controlled
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Elastic rhythm under control. No peak fatigue. No new PRs expected.
macro_structure.notes: Exit block. No taper. Leaves buffer to pivot into pre-season or sport-specific meso. Secondary MDP bias should be locked by Week 9.

week_4.purpose: Confirm Foundation → Force transition is safe. Catch asymmetry or sprint intolerance early.
week_4.action_if_fail: Extend Meso 2 by 1 week or regress to Meso 1 sprint intent

week_8.purpose: Confirm elastic transfer is tracking. Confirm CNS is not overloaded before final push.
week_8.action_if_fail: Extend Meso 3 by 1 week or reduce Meso 4 contact volume
week_8.action_if_pass: Proceed to Meso 4 (final consolidation) as planned

exit_state.exit_assessment: Conducted end of Week 12. Athlete should not be fatigued or sore.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Athlete exits with a durable athletic base and controlled max-V exposure. No deload taper. Pre-season meso stacks immediately with unrestricted sprint access and secondary MDP bias routing.

special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed session = skipped stimulus. Do not attempt to catch up. Resume where you are in the progression.
special_rules.secondary_mdp_bias_decision_note: Must be communicated by end of Week 6. Effective for routing starting Week 7 (Meso 3).
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain meso order; do not compress missed volume; preserve weekly operating ranges. Shift timeline but preserve structure.
special_rules.tier_3_prohibition: Tier 3 (E3, E4) remains forbidden throughout. Max E-node allowed: E2.
special_rules.peaking_rule: Off-season is NOT a peak block. Athletes should feel strong, not exhausted, exiting Week 12. Session ceilings are NOT targets.

governance_checklist: ✅ Population ceilings respected (Band_2, Node C)
✅ Off-season weekly ranges enforced (2x/week)
✅ E-node legality enforced (E2 max)
✅ CNS budget appropriate for frequency
✅ No injury or R2P conflicts
✅ Session structure required (PRIME → CLEAR)
✅ Plyo contacts: weekly operating range defined per meso
✅ Sprint meters: TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax) enforced
✅ Weekly ranges enforced; session ceilings not targets
✅ Assessment gates defined (Week 4, Week 8)
✅ Meso 4 sprint intent revised to MAXV_CONTROLLED (prep for unrestricted)
✅ Meso 4 plyo contacts increased to 100–120 (bridge to pre-season 80–120)

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: Read block_id, load meso_structure, pass block_tags + legality_check constraints to downstream layers. Do NOT advance progression; that is Gate Engine's job.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Sum plyo_contacts and sprint_meters across the week. Validate against [min, max] operating ranges per meso. Flag if weekly total exceeds max or falls below min (informational only; does not block session execution).
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Enforce FV zones, CNS per_day splits, sprint_intent type. Validate sprint intensity ≥90% Vmax for meter counting. Enforce session caps (informational). Perform final fail-safe selection. This is the decision layer.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Evaluate assessment_gates at Week 4 and Week 8. Require explicit pass flag before advancing to next meso. If gate fails, route to meso extension or regression action per assessment_gates definition. Gate Engine controls meso progression, not Block Selector.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should cross-reference this file to explain secondary MDP bias decision deadline, exit conditions, no-makeup rule, calendar flexibility rules, and enforcement ownership.
integration_notes.integration_sequence: Block Selector → WEEKLY_ACCUMULATOR (passive monitoring) → EXERCISE_SELECTION_ALGORITHM (zone/intent enforcement, sprint validation, fail-safe selection) → GATE_ENGINE (Week 4 & 8 assessment, meso advance decision)
integration_notes.future_versioning: As EFL scales, create separate blocks: SP_PRESEASON_*, SP_INSEASON_*, REHAB_*, etc. Each gets its own block_id and meso_structure following this schema. Use block_tags for routing and filtering.

v1.0.1_to_v1.0.2: REVISION 1: Meso 4 sprint_intent changed from MAXV_RHYTHM to MAXV_CONTROLLED. Rationale: Better narrative bridge to pre-season MAX_V_UNRESTRICTED. Same distance range (400–600m), same intent (high-quality), clearer progression label.

REVISION 2: Meso 4 plyo_contact_range increased from 80–100 to 100–120/week. Rationale: Smoother entry into pre-season Meso 1 (80–120). If athletes gate-pass, they're ready for higher contact volume in pre-season.
REVISION 3: exit_state.ready_for_block now references SP_PRESEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_v1 (explicit next block). Rationale: Deterministic Block Selector routing.
REVISION 4: Added changelog section for version tracking and transparency.

manifest_description: Pre-season SP Performance block for Youth 13-17, 6-week bridge from off-season base to in-season readiness. Uses Load Standards v2.1.2 and Governance v4.0. Session ceilings are not targets.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Bridge from controlled max-V off-season work to sport-like speed and COD while testing elastic tolerance.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Speed–Strength / Elastic-reactive without shock
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Agility / COD rhythm

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Unrestricted max-V and flying sprints at ≥90% Vmax, plus controlled COD-entry sprints. Distance: 600–800m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Within Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON band (120–180). Operating range; not a target.

sprint_meters_range.note: Within Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON band (600–1000). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax).

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Max-V / flying emphasis + strength contrast.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: COD entry, decel skill, sub-max elastic.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but ramped from off-season.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 only; E3 locked pending Week 3 gate. Emphasis on controlled stiffness, landing quality, and COD entry angles.
macro_structure.notes: This meso makes speed and COD look and feel like sport, but holds back E3 shock until tolerance is proven.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Consolidate sport-speed, COD, and elastic tolerance with conditional E3 access while preserving freshness for season start.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Speed–Strength (high-velocity force, some E3 plyo)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: COD variability and deceleration control

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Max-V, COD variability, and decel-heavy sprints at ≥90% Vmax. Distance: 800–1000m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Upper half of Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON band. Tier 3 (E3) contacts ≤40% of session total.

sprint_meters_range.note: Upper end of Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON band (600–1000). Only ≥90% Vmax counts.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: E3-access plyos (if earned) + max-V or COD emphasis by bias.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Supportive strength, sub-max elastic, and COD rhythm.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but controlled; preserve readiness for in-season.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3 allowed if Week 3 gate passes, with Tier 3 ≤40% of contacts. If gate fails, stay E1–E2 and bias volume toward quality COD and landing.
macro_structure.notes: This meso is where sport bias matters most. JUMP, SPEED, or COD bias drives exercise selection, not block legality.

week_3.purpose: Decide if athlete can safely access E3 plyos in Meso 2 while respecting Tier 3 ≤40% contact rule.
week_3.action_if_fail: Keep E3 locked (E1–E2 only) for Weeks 4–6. Adjust plyo weekly range to 120–140 and sprint range to 600–800m/week.
week_3.action_if_pass: Set e3_unlocked = true for Weeks 4–6. Maintain plyo 140–180 and sprint 800–1000m/week within Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON band.

week_6.purpose: Confirm athlete is ready to enter in-season with full-speed exposures and no peak fatigue.
week_6.action_if_fail: Route to a low-CNS consolidation or partial deload meso, or repeat final 2 weeks at reduced volume.
week_6.action_if_pass: Advance to in-season maintenance or sport-specific in-season block as defined by Block Selector.

exit_state.exit_assessment: Conducted end of Week 6. Athlete should feel fast, coordinated, and fresh—not in a fatigue peak.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Athlete exits with full-speed and COD exposure that resembles sport. E3 is earned, not assumed. In-season block can safely reduce volume while preserving speed qualities.

special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed session = skipped stimulus. Do not attempt to catch up. Resume where you are in the progression.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain meso order; do not compress missed volume; preserve weekly operating ranges. Shift timeline but preserve structure.
special_rules.tier_3_fraction_rule: E3/E4 (Tier 3) contacts must remain ≤40% of total session contacts in all weeks.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 sprint exposures per week for Youth 13-17. No single session should exceed 800m true sprint meters.
special_rules.peaking_rule: Pre-season is a bridge, not a peak. Athletes should feel fast and prepared, not exhausted, at Week 6.

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 absolute ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).
✅ Pre-season weekly operating ranges enforced (120–180 plyo, 600–1000m sprint).
✅ E3 access conditional on Week 3 gate; Tier 3 ≤40% per session.
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax) enforced with missing-intensity quarantine.
✅ CNS budget marked HIGH but controlled via 2x/week structure.
✅ No change to Load Standards or Governance rules; block intent layered on top.
✅ Exit state explicitly routes to in-season maintenance block.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When season_type = PRESEASON and block_id from off-season exit_state is SP_PRESEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_v1, select this block and pass legality_check and block_tags downstream. Do not manage E3 unlock or meso progression.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters per week. Validate against Youth_13_17 PRE_SEASON band: 120–180 plyo, 600–1000m sprint. Flag but do not block if outside range.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Enforce fv_zones_allowed, cns_per_day, sprint_intent, and Tier 3 ≤40% contacts when e3_unlocked = true. Validate intensity_percent_vmax ≥90% before counting sprint meters.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: At Week 3, evaluate elastic_tolerance, cns_response, movement_quality to set e3_unlocked flag. At Week 6, evaluate exit conditions to decide in-season advancement.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should describe how off-season secondary MDP bias carries into this block, how E3 is earned via Week 3 gate, and why pre-season is not a peaking phase.
integration_notes.future_versioning: Future variants may include sport-specific pre-season blocks (FIELD, COURT) with same legality but different macro_structure and block_tags.

manifest_description: In-season SP Performance maintenance block for Youth 13-17, 6-week cycle designed for high fixture density (Tier 1). Preserves speed and strength with minimal fatigue and strict respect for Load Standards v2.1.2.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Stabilize strength and speed qualities built in pre-season while accommodating high game load.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Speed–Strength / elastic (minimal E3, if at all)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: COD rhythm tuned to sport demands

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Maintain exposure to max-V and short accelerations at ≥90% Vmax, with COD that mirrors sport but stays low-volume. Distance: 400–600m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Lower half of Youth 13-17 IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (60–100). Operating range; not a target.

sprint_meters_range.note: Lower to mid of Youth 13-17 IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (400–800). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax).

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Brief speed/accel touches + low-volume strength.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Tissue maintenance, decel skill, mobility.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate overall, with clear contrast to game load.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 primary; E3 use extremely limited or zero if game density is high. Tier 3 ≤40% of contacts but most weeks should sit near 0–10%.
macro_structure.notes: Assumes practice and games carry majority of COD and high-speed load. Training preserves quality, not volume.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Reinforce key qualities (speed, COD, and robustness) without increasing fatigue as season progresses.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic/reactive sprinkles if tolerance and schedule allow
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: COD and decel maintenance

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Small doses of max-V and light COD variability at ≥90% Vmax. Distance: 400–800m/week (true sprint meters only), depending on fixture load.

plyo_contact_range.note: Full Youth 13-17 IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (60–100). Adjust toward lower end in heavy game weeks.

sprint_meters_range.note: Full Youth 13-17 IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (400–800). Practice/game sprints may consume part of this budget.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Short, sharp exposures to speed/COD based on bias (JUMP/SPEED/COD).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Tissue robustness, isometrics, and controlled landing patterns.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate, trending slightly down if fixture density increases.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Tier 3 (E3) allowed but not required; if used, keep to small sprinkles and respect ≤40% of session contacts.
macro_structure.notes: Adjust intensity and Tier 3 usage week-to-week based on games_per_week and readiness_flag.

week_3.purpose: Ensure in-season maintenance is not accumulating problematic fatigue or pain.
week_3.action_if_fail: Reduce plyo and sprint ranges to lower half of band (e.g., 60 contacts/week, 400m/week) and remove E3 entirely for remaining weeks.
week_3.action_if_pass: Continue with planned ranges; allow small Tier 3 sprinkles when schedule allows.

week_6.purpose: Confirm readiness to either continue in-season maintenance or transition to post-season or another in-season tier.
week_6.action_if_fail: Route to deload or post-season restoration block with lower volumes and Zone 8 emphasis.
week_6.action_if_pass: Extend or repeat in-season maintenance block or transition to appropriate next block per season context.

exit_state.exit_assessment: Conducted end of Week 6. Athlete should feel stable, resilient, and not trending toward overuse.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Block can be repeated for another 6 weeks, downshifted to a lower-load in-season variant, or routed to post-season, depending on calendar and readiness.

special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed session = skipped stimulus. Do not attempt to catch up. Resume where you are in the progression.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain meso order; do not compress missed volume; preserve weekly operating ranges. Adapt around game/tournament weeks without breaking structure.
special_rules.tier_3_fraction_rule: E3/E4 (Tier 3) contacts must remain ≤40% of total session contacts; in high fixture weeks, target near 0–10%.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 sprint exposures per week for Youth 13-17 (practice + training). No single session should exceed 800m true sprint meters.
special_rules.fixture_dependency_note: If games_per_week ≥3, default to lower ends of plyo and sprint ranges and remove planned E3.
special_rules.peaking_rule: In-season maintenance is not a peak block. Objective is robustness and quality, not new max outputs.

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 absolute ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).
✅ In-season Tier 1 weekly operating ranges enforced (60–100 plyo, 400–800m sprint).
✅ Tier 3 (E3/E4) fraction constrained to ≤40% of session contacts, with guidance to minimize in high fixture weeks.
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY (≥90% Vmax) enforced and intensity field required.
✅ CNS load labeled MODERATE and compatible with high fixture density.
✅ Block relies on practice/games for majority of high-CNS load; training preserves qualities.
✅ Exit state permits repeat, downshift, or transition based on calendar and readiness.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When season_type = IN_SEASON_TIER_1 and prior block exit_state allows in-season maintenance, select SP_INSEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_MAINT_v1. Use games_per_week to decide whether to continue or downshift on next cycle.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters per week. Validate against Youth_13_17 IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band: 60–100 plyo, 400–800m sprint. Flag trend toward upper range in heavy fixture weeks.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Enforce fv_zones_allowed, cns_per_day, sprint_intent, and Tier 3 ≤40% contacts, with bias to minimal Tier 3 when games_per_week is high. Validate intensity_percent_vmax ≥90% before counting sprint meters.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: At Week 3 and Week 6, evaluate health/fatigue gates and decide whether to adjust volume ranges, remove Tier 3, or route to deload/post-season.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should explain that in-season blocks are maintenance-focused, rely on sport for most high-CNS load, and treat Tier 3 and volume ceilings as levers to pull back, not to chase.
integration_notes.future_versioning: Future variants may include IN_SEASON_TIER_2 and IN_SEASON_TIER_3 blocks with higher operating ranges and different CNS strategies.

manifest_description: Post-season SP Performance restoration block for Youth 13-17, 6-week cycle. Downshifts load after a full season, emphasizes tissue restoration, movement quality, and low-CNS agility. Uses Load Standards v2.1.2 POST_SEASON ranges.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Downshift from in-season stress, restore tissues, and clean up movement quality with low-CNS work.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Mobility, coordination, and low-intensity agility

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Short, technical accelerations and form drills at 70–85% Vmax. Only reps at ≥90% Vmax count as sprint meters.

plyo_contact_range.note: Within Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON band (60–120). Emphasis on low-intensity E1–E2 contacts.

sprint_meters_range.note: Lower half of Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON band (300–600). Use TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY at ≥90% Vmax.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Strength robustness + gentle elastic work.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Movement quality, mobility, and low-impact COD.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Low; purpose is restoration, not pushing new peaks.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 allowed with focus on landing quality and decel control. Avoid Tier 3 shock and high boxes.
macro_structure.notes: Ideal time for technical work, asymmetry clean-up, and pain reduction.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Maintain restored state while gently nudging strength and speed qualities toward next off-season.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Agility and coordination in multiple planes

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Occasional near-max accelerations at ≥90% Vmax in very low volume. Distance still sits in 300–600m/week band.

plyo_contact_range.note: Top of Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON band (60–120). Keep most contacts at E1–E2, brief E3 sprinkles only if needed and well-tolerated.

sprint_meters_range.note: Full Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON band (300–600). Do not exceed, as next macro will handle volume ramp.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Short, sharp exposures (accel or light COD) plus strength.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Mobility, stability, and low-CNS skill work.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate at most, with built-in room for fatigue from other activities.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Primarily E1–E2; optional small Tier 3 (E3) segments if athlete is fully recovered and no pain/swelling flags exist.
macro_structure.notes: Acts as a soft on-ramp toward the next off-season or development block.

week_3.purpose: Confirm post-season block is reducing pain and tightness rather than adding fatigue.
week_3.action_if_fail: Lower plyo and sprint ranges (e.g., 60 contacts, 300m/week), remove any E3, and bias sessions toward Zone 8 and Band 1 strength.
week_3.action_if_pass: Allow progression into gentle build-forward meso with moderate volumes inside POST_SEASON bands.

week_6.purpose: Determine readiness to enter an off-season development block or stay in low load if issues persist.
week_6.action_if_fail: Route to a second restoration block or targeted corrective/rehab block rather than off-season high volume.
week_6.action_if_pass: Advance to an OFF_SEASON development block (e.g., SP_OFFSEASON_MULTI_13-17_12WK_DEV_v1 when defined).

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6. Athlete should feel better than at end of season and ready to tolerate a gradual off-season volume ramp.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Provide a clean transition into higher-load off-season work, with clear notes on any remaining guardrails.

special_rules.tier3_minimize_rule: Tier 3 plyos (E3/E4) should be minimized or omitted in POST_SEASON unless explicitly justified.
special_rules.no_peaking_rule: No performance peaking. This phase is for restoration, not chasing new PBs.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed sessions are not made up by increasing contacts or sprint meters later.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain low-CNS, restoration intent even if calendar weeks shift. Do not compress into fewer than 4 weeks.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: If any sessions include ≥90% Vmax work, keep total sprint exposures ≤3/week and within POST_SEASON volume band.

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 absolute ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).
✅ Post-season weekly operating ranges enforced (60–120 plyos, 300–600m sprint).
✅ Tier 3 use minimized and clearly de-emphasized.
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY rule used with conservative weekly ranges.
✅ CNS budget LOW–MODERATE, appropriate for restoration.
✅ Exit state routes toward off-season development, not directly to high-load blocks without checks.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When season_type = POST_SEASON for Youth_13_17 SP_Performance and readiness_flag is GREEN or YELLOW (no critical red flags), select SP_POSTSEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_RESTORE_v1 as default post-season block.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs Youth_13_17 POST_SEASON band (60–120, 300–600). Flag but do not auto-block minor excursions.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Bias toward Z5/Z6/Z8 in meso 1 and only small Z3 exposures in meso 2. Keep Tier 3 usage minimal and enforce per-session contact caps.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 3 and Week 6 gates to ensure the block is actually restorative before allowing transition to off-season development.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should describe this as a decompression block after heavy fixture load, where the goal is feeling and moving better, not accumulating volume.
integration_notes.future_versioning: Future variants may include sport-specific post-season blocks (e.g., FIELD_POST, COURT_POST) and shorter 3-week restoration options.

manifest_description: Off-season SP Performance development block for Youth 13-17, 12-week cycle. Highest-volume development window, focused on strength, speed, and elastic qualities within Load Standards v2.1.2 OFF_SEASON ranges.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Build foundational strength and low-to-moderate elastic tolerance as a base for later off-season intensity.
macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Short accelerations at ≥90% Vmax with clean mechanics. Distance: 800–900m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Low half of Youth 13-17 OFF_SEASON band (140–200). Emphasis on E1–E2; minimal E3.

sprint_meters_range.note: Within Youth 13-17 OFF_SEASON band (800–1200). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY ≥90% Vmax.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Primary strength + accel work.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Supportive strength, sub-max elastic, and COD skill.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but manageable; build capacity without peaking.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 primary; E3 only for advanced athletes with perfect readiness and within ≤40% Tier 3 session rule.
macro_structure.notes: Bias secondary MDP according to athlete profile (JUMP/SPEED/COD) from Week 1.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Increase power, top-end speed, and elastic output while respecting Youth 13-17 Tier 3 limits.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic/reactive plyos (E2–E3 within caps)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Max-V and flying sprints at ≥90–100% Vmax. Distance: 900–1100m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Upper half of OFF_SEASON band (140–200). Tier 3 (E3/E4) ≤40% of session contacts.

sprint_meters_range.note: Near upper OFF_SEASON band (800–1200) but not exceeding weekly 2000m cap.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: High-intensity sprint and plyo emphasis (respecting Tier 3 rule).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Strength-power and COD at high but controlled CNS load.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High; this is the main output-building meso.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3 allowed, E4 rarely and only for advanced athletes. Always enforce ≤40% Tier 3 fraction per session.
macro_structure.notes: Monitor readiness_flag; downshift volume/intensity when YELLOW.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Consolidate gains, slightly back off volume, and prepare tissues for upcoming pre-season specificity block.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic quality maintenance
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Agility and COD in low-to-moderate volume

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Maintain max-V and acceleration qualities at slightly reduced volume: 800–1000m/week (true sprint meters only).

plyo_contact_range.note: Mid-band OFF_SEASON volume; slight taper from meso 2 while keeping quality high.

sprint_meters_range.note: Within OFF_SEASON band with slight reduction for freshness heading into pre-season.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: High-quality speed/power; no need to chase new PBs.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Supportive strength and COD with moderate CNS cost.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High-to-moderate; begin protecting freshness for next phase.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Keep Tier 3 presence but ensure athletes finish feeling powerful, not fried.
macro_structure.notes: Ideal exit point into SP_PRESEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_v1.

week_4.purpose: Confirm athlete is tolerating foundational volume before advancing to highest-power meso.
week_4.action_if_fail: Extend Meso 1 by 2–3 weeks at current or slightly reduced volume before attempting Meso 2.
week_4.action_if_pass: Advance to Meso 2 with planned OFF_SEASON ranges.

week_8.purpose: Ensure high-intensity block has not created problematic fatigue or pain.
week_8.action_if_fail: Begin taper earlier by shifting to Meso 3 structure with reduced volumes.

week_12.purpose: Decide readiness to enter pre-season block focused on sport-specific exposure.
week_12.action_if_fail: Route to a lighter development or consolidation block instead of pre-season bridge.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 12. Athlete should be powerful, robust, and not overly fatigued.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Pass a well-prepared athlete into pre-season bridge block where sport-specific speed and COD become primary.

special_rules.tier3_fraction_rule: E3/E4 contacts must remain ≤40% of total session plyo contacts in all weeks.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed sessions are not made up by exceeding weekly caps or increasing sprint meters later.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain meso order even if calendar shifts. Do not compress total off-season duration below 8 weeks without explicit override.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 sprint exposures per week. No single session exceeds 800m true sprint meters for Youth 13-17.

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 absolute ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).
✅ OFF_SEASON operating ranges enforced (140–200 plyos, 800–1200m sprint/week).
✅ Tier 3 contacts limited to ≤40% of session total.
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY with intensity_percent_vmax required for counting.
✅ Gates at weeks 4, 8, and 12 regulate progression and exit.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When season_type = OFF_SEASON for Youth_13_17 SP_Performance and readiness_flag is GREEN, prefer SP_OFFSEASON_MULTI_13-17_12WK_DEV_v1 as default development block.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Validate weekly plyo and sprint volumes against Youth_13_17 OFF_SEASON band (140–200, 800–1200). Flag over/under trends.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Enforce fv_zones, Tier 3 ≤40% rule, and sprint intensity ≥90% Vmax before counting volume.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Control meso transitions at weeks 4 and 8, and determine pre-season readiness at week 12.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should present this as the main off-season engine that builds strength, speed, and elasticity for Youth 13–17 field/court athletes.

manifest_description: Basketball-specific pre-season SP Performance block for Youth 13-17, 6 weeks. Bridges off-season development into court-speed, vertical jump, and COD demands while staying within Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON bands.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Convert off-season strength and speed into basketball-relevant vertical jumping, short-court speed, and COD while keeping fatigue controlled.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic vertical jumps and low–moderate intensity E3, within caps
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Basketball COD and shuttles (e.g., 5–10–5, closeout footwork)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: 10–20 m linear and curved sprints at ≥90% Vmax (e.g., 3/4-court sprints, arc runs). Distance: 600–800 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:44][web:59]

plyo_contact_range.note: Within Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON band (120–180). Mix of vertical jumps, lateral bounds, and COD landings; Tier 3 ≤40% of session contacts.[file:1][web:43][web:49]

sprint_meters_range.note: Lower half of PRE_SEASON band (600–1000). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY at ≥90% Vmax.[file:1][web:44]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Vertical jump and court-speed focus (closeout sprints, 3/4-court runs).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: COD and decel patterns (shuffle shuttles, M-Drill) plus supportive strength.[web:48][web:53]

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but ramped from off-season; respect court practice layering on top.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Vertical and low-to-moderate intensity E3 plyos featured (e.g., counter-movement jumps, low-depth jumps 12–18 in) within Tier 3 ≤40% rule, reflecting high jump demands in basketball.[file:1][web:43][web:55]
macro_structure.notes: Bias VERT or COD based on secondary MDP: more vertical contacts for jumpers, more COD shuttles for guards/wings.[web:54]

macro_structure.primary_goal: Consolidate game-speed sprinting, COD, and vertical jump tolerance in patterns that mimic basketball demands, without overreaching.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic/reactive court plyos (e.g., approach jumps, repeated jumps)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Basketball-specific COD and agility (defensive slides, closeout-into-turn drills)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Court-length or 3/4-court sprints and recovery runs at ≥90–100% Vmax, mimicking transition offense/defense. Distance: 800–1000 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:44][web:57]

plyo_contact_range.note: Upper half of PRE_SEASON band. Emphasize vertical jumps (CMJ, approach jumps) and COD-related landings while keeping Tier 3 ≤40% per session.[file:1][web:43][web:49]

sprint_meters_range.note: Top of PRE_SEASON band; appropriate given basketball’s high directional-change demands but still below weekly 2000 m cap.[file:1][web:59]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: High-intensity court-speed and vertical plyo session (transition sprints + jumps).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: COD, decel and smaller volume vertical jumps, plus strength maintenance.[web:48][web:51]

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but with built-in downshift options when team practice load spikes.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3. Reactive vertical jumps (e.g., repeated jumps, short-contact hops) added cautiously, respecting Tier 3 ≤40%.[file:1][web:47][web:49]
macro_structure.notes: Integrate drills like lateral shuffle shuttles, quarter-arc runs, and single-leg broad to 90 for COD demands specific to basketball.[web:48][web:59]

week_3.purpose: Ensure increase in vertical and COD work is tolerated before operating at upper PRE_SEASON volumes.
week_3.action_if_fail: Hold weekly plyo at 120–140 and sprint meters at 600–800; limit E3 usage and rely more on E1–E2.
week_3.action_if_pass: Allow ascent toward 140–180 plyos/week and 800–1000 m/week sprint in Meso 2.

week_6.purpose: Decide readiness to enter in-season basketball block (Tier 1–3 depending on games/week).
week_6.action_if_fail: Route to lower-load consolidation block or repeat Meso 2 at reduced volume.
week_6.action_if_pass: Advance to SP_INSEASON_BBALL_13-17_6WK_TIER1_v1 or Tier2/3 variant based on fixture density.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6. Athlete should feel bouncy, quick on the court, and not overly fatigued.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Provide a basketball-ready athlete to in-season maintenance block keyed to games/week.

special_rules.tier3_fraction_rule: E3/E4 contacts ≤40% of plyo contacts per session. Vertical depth jumps and intense single-leg bounds must be counted carefully.[file:1]
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: No catch-up volume after missed sessions. Stay inside weekly bands.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain 6-week structure but shift dates if needed; do not compress into <4 weeks without override.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 true sprint exposures per week (≥90% Vmax), including any tracked team conditioning sessions.

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).[file:1]
✅ PRE_SEASON operating ranges enforced (120–180 plyos, 600–1000m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ Tier 3 contacts constrained to ≤40% per session, suitable for high-jump-demand basketball.[file:1][web:43][web:49]
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY enforced with intensity_percent_vmax for court sprints.[file:1][web:44]
✅ Meso and gates aligned to typical 6-week basketball pre-season structure.[web:44]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, season_type = PRE_SEASON, and primary sport tag = BASKETBALL, prefer SP_PRESEASON_BBALL_13-17_6WK_v1 over generic multi-sport block.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs Youth_13_17 PRE_SEASON band (120–180, 600–1000). Flag heavy jump weeks approaching upper band, given basketball’s already high in-game jump and COD counts.[file:1][web:59]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Favor basketball-relevant sprint and COD patterns (closeouts, shuffle shuttles, arc runs) and vertical plyos drawn from basketball literature.[web:43][web:48][web:55]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 3 and Week 6 gates to modulate vertical/COD load and decide readiness for in-season basketball blocks.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should explain that this is the basketball-specific pre-season bridge: more jumps, more COD, and court-relevant sprinting within Youth 13-17 PRE_SEASON safety bands.

manifest_description: In-season Tier 1 (high fixture) basketball-specific maintenance block for Youth 13-17, 6 weeks. Maintains strength, vertical jump, and COD with low extra load on top of games and practices, aligned to Youth 13-17 IN_SEASON_TIER_1 bands.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Stabilize vertical jump, strength, and COD qualities built in pre-season while respecting heavy practice and game load.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Minimal reactive plyos (sprinkles only)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Court agility (slides, closeouts) in low volume

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Short court sprints (e.g., 3/4 court, closeout sprints) at ≥90% Vmax in low volume: 400–600 m/week true sprint meters, counting only high-intensity reps.[file:1][web:69]

plyo_contact_range.note: Lower half of IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (60–100). Most jump/COD load comes from practices and games; training tops up qualities.[file:1][web:63]

sprint_meters_range.note: Lower-to-mid IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (400–800). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY ≥90% Vmax.[file:1][web:61]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Brief speed/jump micro-dose + strength maintenance (full-body, 20–30 min style). [web:68][web:72]
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Tissue robustness, mobility, and light COD patterns.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate; avoid competing with practice for CNS capacity.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Primarily E1–E2 (low/moderate jumps). E3 only rarely and never near games, respecting ≤40% Tier 3 fraction.[file:1][web:63]
macro_structure.notes: Place higher-CNS day furthest from games when possible; follow in-season best practice of 1–2 short strength sessions/week.[web:64][web:68]

macro_structure.primary_goal: Reinforce key explosive and COD qualities mid-season without accumulating fatigue.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Speed–strength and quick accelerations (short court bursts)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic/reactive jump sprinkles (CMJ, low-dose depth jumps)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Defensive slides, closeouts, and small-sided COD patterns

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Occasional full or 3/4-court sprints at ≥90–100% Vmax in very controlled volume: 400–800 m/week true sprint meters, depending on fixture density.[file:1][web:69]

plyo_contact_range.note: Full IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band. Adjust toward 60 in heavy game weeks, toward 100 in lighter weeks.[file:1][web:61]

sprint_meters_range.note: Full IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band (400–800). Include tracked high-intensity sprint components from practice if available.[file:1][web:69]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Short performance-focused session (jumps + strength) 20–30 min, 1–2x/week model.[web:66][web:68]
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Durability and coordination; can be dropped in very heavy weeks.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate; may trend down if travel or fixture intensity increases.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Maintain vertical and COD jump qualities with small, well-timed doses. Depth jumps or E3 reserved for very light weeks and never near back-to-back games.[file:1][web:63]
macro_structure.notes: VERT bias = slightly more jump maintenance; SPEED bias = slightly more court sprint touches; COD bias = slightly more slide/closeout work.[web:54]

week_3.purpose: Ensure added training load is not driving in-season fatigue or pain.
week_3.action_if_fail: Drop to bottom of bands (60 plyos, 400m sprint), remove E3, and prioritize strength maintenance + mobility.
week_3.action_if_pass: Maintain or slightly adjust within bands based on practice/game load.

week_6.purpose: Decide whether to repeat block, downshift load, or route toward post-season.
week_6.action_if_fail: Shift to lower-load in-season or start post-season restore block early.
week_6.action_if_pass: Repeat or progress to another 6-week in-season block depending on calendar; later route to SP_POSTSEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_RESTORE_v1.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6 or at logical season checkpoint. Focus is on sustaining, not peaking.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Transition into restoration block or continue in-season maintenance depending on season length.

special_rules.fixture_dependency_rule: If games_per_week ≥3, always use lower ends of plyo and sprint ranges and remove Tier 3 jumps.[file:1][web:69]
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: No extra jumps or sprints to make up missed sessions.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Block can be repeated or shortened to match season segments, but weekly bands must be respected.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 true sprint exposures/week (practice + training), in line with Youth 13-17 sprint session caps.[file:1]

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).[file:1]
✅ IN_SEASON_TIER_1 bands enforced (60–100 plyos, 400–800m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ Tier 3 (E3/E4) capped at ≤40% of session contacts and minimized in high-fixture weeks.[file:1][web:49]
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY used to integrate basketball speed work without overcounting.[file:1][web:61]
✅ Structure aligns with evidence supporting low-frequency, mixed-type plyos in-season for youth basketball.[web:49][web:63]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, season_type = IN_SEASON_TIER_1, and sport = BASKETBALL, select SP_INSEASON_BBALL_13-17_6WK_TIER1_v1 as default in-season maintenance block.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs IN_SEASON_TIER_1 band and flag any weeks trending toward upper band in heavy fixture periods.[file:1][web:69]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Favor basketball-relevant jumps, COD, and strength work in short, sustainable sessions, per in-season guidelines.[web:68][web:72]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 3 and Week 6 gates to modulate load and determine whether to maintain, repeat, or off-ramp into post-season.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should frame this as the default in-season basketball maintenance plan: small, smart doses that protect freshness while maintaining explosiveness.

manifest_description: Post-season basketball-specific restoration block for Youth 13-17, 4 weeks. Downshifts jump and COD load after the season, emphasizes recovery, movement quality, and low-CNS court work within Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON bands.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Reduce cumulative jump and COD stress from the season, restore tissues, and tidy movement quality with low-CNS work.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z6: Hypertrophy / capacity only for weak links where needed
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Mobility, coordination, and light court agility

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Low-intensity on-court movement (sub-max shuttles, jogging) with very limited ≥90% Vmax sprints. Only a small number of high-effort reps count as sprint meters.[file:1][web:80][web:83]

plyo_contact_range.note: Within Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON band (60–120). Focus on low-intensity vertical and lateral jumps; Tier 3 work effectively removed.[file:1][web:84]

sprint_meters_range.note: Full POST_SEASON band (300–600). Keep high-intensity sprint work minimal; most movement is sub-max recovery work.[file:1][web:77][web:79]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Strength robustness and light mobility + low-amplitude jumps.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Active recovery on court (light ball handling, movement prep, mobility).

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Low CNS; recovery and reset are primary. No peaking or heavy loading.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 only; no planned E3/E4. Emphasize soft landings, controlled decel, and avoiding excessive vertical volume after a long season.[file:1][web:81]
macro_structure.notes: Supports post-season priorities of rest, active recovery, and gradual transition into off-season strength work.[web:75][web:79][web:84]

week_2.purpose: Verify that post-season block is reducing soreness and fatigue rather than adding stress.
week_2.action_if_fail: Lower to minimum bands (60 plyos, 300m sprint), remove all E2, and bias sessions to mobility and very light strength.

week_4.purpose: Determine readiness to begin off-season development or whether additional restoration is needed.
week_4.action_if_fail: Repeat or extend restoration block or direct to individualized rehab if pain or fatigue persist.
week_4.action_if_pass: Advance to SP_OFFSEASON_MULTI_13-17_12WK_DEV_v1 or basketball-specific off-season block depending on calendar.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 4. Athlete should feel physically and mentally fresher than at season end.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Provide a clean, recovered starting point for off-season strength and power development.

special_rules.rest_priority_rule: Ensure at least 2 true rest days per week from organized basketball activity during this block, aligning with youth recovery guidance.[web:79][web:88]
special_rules.tier3_minimize_rule: E3/E4 plyos should be absent; any accidental Tier 3 exposure (e.g., pick-up games) should reduce training load that week.[file:1]
special_rules.no_testing_rule: No max testing (e.g., 1RM, max vertical) in post-season. Save formal testing for later phases.[web:84][web:83]
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Do not make up missed sessions with extra volume. Recovery intent takes precedence.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Post-season window 3–6 weeks; this block covers 4 weeks and can be repeated if season was long or athlete is very fatigued.[web:84]

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 POST_SEASON bands respected (60–120 plyos, 300–600m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ CNS budget LOW, consistent with post-season recovery goals.[web:84][web:81]
✅ Tier 3 effectively removed to offload jump/COD stress after a season.[file:1]
✅ Emphasis on rest, active recovery, and low-intensity work matches youth basketball recovery best practices.[web:75][web:79][web:88]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, sport = BASKETBALL, and season_type = POST_SEASON, select SP_POSTSEASON_BBALL_13-17_4WK_RESTORE_v1 as default unless RED flags require medical/rehab blocks.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Ensure plyo_contacts and sprint_meters remain in POST_SEASON band and trend down relative to in-season loads.[file:1][web:84]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Favor low-intensity court movement, mobility, and light strength; automatically avoid high-intensity jumps and sprints in this phase.[web:75][web:81]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 2 and Week 4 gates to confirm that this block is actually restorative before allowing transition to higher loads.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should present this as the decompression phase for youth basketball—less pounding, more recovery and movement quality before starting off-season work.[web:84][web:81]

manifest_description: Off-season basketball-specific development block for Youth 13-17, 8 weeks. Emphasizes total-body strength, vertical power, and court speed within Youth 13-17 OFF_SEASON bands.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Rebuild and extend strength and vertical jump foundations specific to basketball after a restore phase.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Intro power (box jumps, countermovement jumps, short accelerations)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Short accelerations (5–20m) at ≥90% Vmax from basketball starts (half-court, 3/4-court). Distance: 800–900 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:82][web:98]

plyo_contact_range.note: Lower half of OFF_SEASON band (140–200). Bias vertical and low–moderate intensity E2, with limited E3.[file:1][web:99]

sprint_meters_range.note: Inside OFF_SEASON band (800–1200). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY ≥90% Vmax.[file:1][web:94]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Weightroom strength + low-dose plyos; main off-season strength day as per HS basketball guidelines.[web:82][web:104]
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Court-based speed/COD and lighter strength/accessory work.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but controlled; build capacity without max peaking.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 primary (box jumps, CMJ, low-amplitude bounds); E3 (low depth jumps, single-leg bounds) only for advanced athletes within ≤40% Tier 3 rule.[file:1][web:99]
macro_structure.notes: Aligns with advice to push strength/power in off-season but progress gradually and respect technique.[web:66][web:95]

macro_structure.primary_goal: Increase power and court speed qualities (vertical, first step, transition speed) while staying in OFF_SEASON bands.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Speed–strength (med ball throws, jumps, resisted sprints)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic/reactive jumps (repeated CMJ, short depth jumps)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z1: Max-V court sprints (3/4 and full court)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: 3/4 and full-court sprints, transition runs, and curved sprints at ≥90–100% Vmax. Distance: 900–1200 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:82][web:94]

plyo_contact_range.note: Upper OFF_SEASON band; vertical and COD jumps. Tier 3 ≤40% of session contacts.[file:1][web:99]

sprint_meters_range.note: Top of OFF_SEASON band; still below 2000 m weekly ceiling.[file:1][web:94]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Strength + power emphasis (e.g., trap bar, split squats, CMJ, med ball).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Court speed and COD emphasis (transition sprints, COD drills) + lighter strength.[web:82][web:96]

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High; main output-building meso for basketball off-season.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: More E2/E3 within Tier 3 ≤40% rule. Avoid E4 except in very advanced cases with excellent readiness.[file:1][web:99]
macro_structure.notes: Reflects off-season suggestion to push volume and intensity more than in-season while allowing rest days between high-CNS sessions.[web:66][web:104]

week_4.purpose: Ensure foundational off-season volume is well tolerated before power-heavy meso.
week_4.action_if_fail: Extend Meso 1 by 2–4 weeks at same or slightly reduced volume; delay high-power Meso 2.

week_8.purpose: Decide readiness to shift into basketball pre-season bridge.
week_8.action_if_fail: Route to consolidation or repeat part of Meso 2 with reduced volume before pre-season.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 8. Athlete should feel stronger, more explosive, and not overly fatigued.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Deliver a robust, powerful basketball athlete into the pre-season court-speed block.

special_rules.tier3_fraction_rule: E3/E4 contacts ≤40% of plyo contacts per session; most weeks will sit under this.[file:1]
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: No extra jumps or sprints to compensate missed sessions.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Off-season window 8–12 weeks; this block can be repeated or extended to cover that range. Do not cram volume into fewer weeks.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 true sprint exposures/week, including any extra team or open-gym speed work.[file:1]

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 absolute ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).[file:1]
✅ OFF_SEASON bands enforced (140–200 plyos/week, 800–1200m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ Tier 3 constrained to ≤40% of contacts; E4 effectively optional.[file:1][web:99]
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY with intensity_percent_vmax enforced.[file:1][web:94]
✅ Structure aligns with off-season basketball S&C principles: higher strength/power volume, full-body focus, 2–3 heavy days/week total.[web:82][web:104]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, sport = BASKETBALL, and season_type = OFF_SEASON, select SP_OFFSEASON_BBALL_13-17_8WK_DEV_v1 as default off-season development block.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs Youth_13_17 OFF_SEASON bands; flag if consistently near upper edge.[file:1]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Implement full-body strength + basketball-relevant jumps and sprints per off-season guidelines.[web:82][web:66]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 4 and Week 8 gates to prevent overreaching and ensure readiness for pre-season.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should present this as the main off-season engine for 13–17 basketball players, coordinated with skill work and open-gym play.[web:11][web:82]

manifest_description: In-season Tier 2 (moderate fixture) basketball-specific block for Youth 13-17, 6 weeks. Maintains and develops strength, vertical power, and COD with more training headroom than Tier 1, aligned to Youth 13-17 IN_SEASON_TIER_2 bands.

macro_structure.primary_goal: With 1–2 games/week, maintain and slightly build strength, vertical jump, and COD beyond Tier 1 levels while managing fatigue.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic/reactive jumps in low–moderate volume
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Basketball-relevant COD and footwork

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: 3/4-court and half-court sprints at ≥90–100% Vmax, usually 600–800 m/week true sprint meters (practice + training combined).[file:1][web:69][web:119]

plyo_contact_range.note: Within lower-middle IN_SEASON_TIER_2 band (120–180). Balance between training and game jumps.[file:1][web:63]

sprint_meters_range.note: Lower portion of IN_SEASON_TIER_2 band (600–1000). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY ≥90% Vmax.[file:1][web:111]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Short but intense strength + jump session (e.g., 3–5 sets of low-rep main lifts, low-volume jumps).[web:68][web:110]
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Court speed/COD emphasis with lighter strength/accessory work.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but compatible with 1–2 games/week; follow low-volume, relatively high-intensity in-season strength principles.[web:68][web:110]
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3, with Tier 3 ≤40% of contacts. Emphasize CMJ, approach jumps, low-depth jumps; avoid very high shock loads close to games.[file:1][web:63][web:65]
macro_structure.notes: Place Day A strength/jump session furthest from games; Day B closer to mid-week practice or lighter fixture days.[web:69][web:110]

macro_structure.primary_goal: Reinforce gains mid-season while protecting freshness as games accumulate.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Reactive jumps in very targeted amounts
fv_zone_emphasis.Z5: Low-volume heavy sets to prevent strength loss
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Defensive slides, closeouts, and small-sided COD

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Game-speed court sprints (transition, recovery) in 600–1000 m/week true sprint meters, scaled to games/week and practice intensity.[file:1][web:69]

plyo_contact_range.note: Full IN_SEASON_TIER_2 band. Use lower end in busy weeks and upper end when schedule allows.[file:1][web:61]

sprint_meters_range.note: Full IN_SEASON_TIER_2 band (600–1000). Include tracked high-intensity sprint segments from practices when available.[file:1][web:113]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Heavier but low-volume strength + key jump patterns (e.g., 3–4x2–3 reps).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Primarily movement quality, robustness, and light COD; can be dropped in heavy weeks.[web:68][web:110]

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate-to-high early in meso; can be dialed back toward moderate if fatigue indicators rise.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Maintain vertical/COD jump qualities with small, high-quality doses. Tier 3 reserved for weeks with clear readiness and lighter fixtures.[file:1][web:63][web:65]
macro_structure.notes: VERT bias = more vertical jump emphasis; SPEED bias = slightly more sprint touches; COD bias = more shuttles/slides.[web:70][web:96]

week_3.purpose: Verify that increased in-season training load (vs Tier 1) is tolerated alongside 1–2 games/week.
week_3.action_if_fail: Drop to IN_SEASON_TIER_1 ranges (60–100 plyos, 400–800m sprint) and/or route to SP_INSEASON_BBALL_13-17_6WK_TIER1_v1.
week_3.action_if_pass: Maintain or fine-tune within Tier 2 bands.

week_6.purpose: Decide whether to repeat Tier 2 block, downshift to Tier 1, or move toward post-season restore.
week_6.action_if_fail: Downshift to Tier 1 or go early to SP_POSTSEASON_BBALL_13-17_4WK_RESTORE_v1.
week_6.action_if_pass: Repeat Tier 2 phase if season continues or proceed to Tier 1/post-season according to calendar.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6 or logical season turning point.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Transition to lower-load in-season, repeat Tier 2, or move to post-season based on schedule and athlete status.

special_rules.fixture_dependency_rule: If games_per_week drops to 1 for multiple weeks, Tier 2 is appropriate; if it rises to 3+, route to Tier 1 logic.[file:1][web:108][web:112]
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Do not add extra volume to make up missed sessions.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Block can be repeated back-to-back; weekly bands still apply.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 true sprint exposures/week (practice + training), in line with Youth 13-17 sprint caps.[file:1]

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).[file:1]
✅ IN_SEASON_TIER_2 bands enforced (120–180 plyos, 600–1000m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ Tier 3 contacts kept ≤40% of session contacts.[file:1][web:63]
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY with intensity_percent_vmax enforced for court sprints.[file:1][web:111]
✅ Structure consistent with moderate-fixture in-season guidelines (low volume, moderate–high intensity strength; careful monitoring of fatigue).[web:68][web:110]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, sport = BASKETBALL, season_type = IN_SEASON_TIER_2 (1–2 games/week), select SP_INSEASON_BBALL_13-17_6WK_TIER2_v1 as default.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs Tier 2 band and flag trends toward upper band if practice loads are also high.[file:1][web:113]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Implement low-volume, moderate–high intensity in-season loading for strength and jumps, consistent with basketball guidelines.[web:68][web:110]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 3 and Week 6 gates to adjust between Tier 1, Tier 2, and post-season paths.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should clarify difference between Tier 1 (heavy fixtures, low extra load) and Tier 2 (moderate fixtures, more training headroom) in basketball.

manifest_description: In-season Tier 3 (low/sparse fixture) basketball-specific block for Youth 13-17, 6 weeks. Allows high development volume (similar to off-season) while managing minimal game/practice load. Typical use: summer leagues, post-tournament phases, or injury rehab in-season windows.

blocks.fixture_context_description: ≤1 game/week or tournament/camp structure; minimal competitive load allows max development stimulus.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Seize the low-fixture window to build strength, vertical power, and COD capacity while games are sparse or light.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Speed–strength and low-duration power work (short accelerations, approach jumps)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic and reactive jumps in meaningful volume (low–moderate depth jumps, repeated CMJ)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z5: Full-body strength work (Band 1–3, multiple sets per pattern)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z1: Court-length and max-V sprints in higher volume
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Basketball COD and agility with high touch count

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: 3/4-court and full-court sprints at ≥90–100% Vmax in higher volume than in-season Tier 1/2: 1000–1200 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:127][web:128]

plyo_contact_range.note: Within IN_SEASON_TIER_3 band (160–240). Emphasis on vertical jumps, reactive plyos, and COD-related landings. Tier 3 ≤40% of session contacts.[file:1][web:129]

sprint_meters_range.note: Lower-middle IN_SEASON_TIER_3 band (1000–1600). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY ≥90% Vmax.[file:1][web:131]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Strength + plyometrics-focused session (e.g., heavy lifts + multiple jump patterns). Can be similar to off-season intensity.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Court speed and max-V sprints, or full-body power + COD. Both days at HIGH CNS due to low game stress.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: HIGH; this is quasi-off-season within competition context. Games/practices are light, so training CNS load is priority.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3 featured prominently. Depth jumps, reactive jumps, and multiple-set jump work allowed and encouraged within Tier 3 ≤40% rule, consistent with development goals.[file:1][web:127]
macro_structure.notes: Place sessions on non-game days; if a tournament or single game occurs, shift to Tier 1 logic for that week, then resume Tier 3.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Consolidate gains from Meso 1 and approach exit state ready to transition back to higher-fixture (Tier 1 or Tier 2) or post-season.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Quality speed–strength (fewer reps, slightly higher intensity/speed)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Reactive jumps in targeted, high-quality doses
fv_zone_emphasis.Z1: Fast-break sprints and transition sprints at max intensity
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Game-speed COD and footwork under fatigue

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Emphasis on explosive court sprints, fast-break patterns, and recovery runs simulating game transitions. Distance: 1000–1600 m/week, scaled toward upper band if fixtures remain sparse.[file:1][web:127]

plyo_contact_range.note: Full IN_SEASON_TIER_3 band (160–240). Ramp toward upper end in Weeks 5–6 if pain-free and readiness high. Tier 3 ≤40%.[file:1][web:129]

sprint_meters_range.note: Full IN_SEASON_TIER_3 band (1000–1600). Approach upper band only if games/practice remain light and athlete shows no fatigue flags.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Heavy or explosive focus (e.g., Power Cleans + box jumps, or trap bar + vertical plyo).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Court-based speed and COD under fatigue, simulating transition defense/offense.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: HIGH, trending toward peaking readiness. Scale slightly down in final week if transitioning to a busier schedule.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3; can include more challenging reactive work (single-leg bounds, depth jumps from moderate heights) as athletic system is fully warmed and adapted.[file:1][web:131]
macro_structure.notes: VERT bias = more vertical jump emphasis; SPEED bias = more sprint/acceleration work; COD bias = more defensive/shuttle patterns. Align to athlete's weak spots or position demands.[web:128][web:134]

week_3.purpose: Verify that high development volume (even with low game load) is tolerated and not causing CNS depletion or injury flags.
week_3.action_if_fail: Downshift to IN_SEASON_TIER_2 or even Tier 1 bands; investigate pain or fatigue source.

week_6.purpose: Assess development gains and decide next routing: return to higher-fixture Tier (1 or 2) when season resumes, or proceed to post-season restore if season ending.
week_6.action_if_fail: Route to lower-load maintenance phase or extend low-fixture development if schedule allows.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6. Athlete should exit stronger, more explosive, and ready to handle higher game density.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Provide a developed, powerful athlete to transition back into maintenance-focused in-season (Tier 1/2) or directly to post-season restore if season ends.

alternative_exits.condition: If season ends; athlete routes directly to restoration.
If schedule normalizes to 1–2 games/week; maintain gains with moderate load.
If schedule intensifies to 3+ games/week; shift to minimal extra load.

special_rules.fixture_dependency_rule: Tier 3 is ONLY valid when games_per_week ≤1 (or effectively 0 in single-tournament weeks). If games_per_week rises mid-block to 2+, immediately downshift to Tier 2 or Tier 1 logic and reduce plyo/sprint volume.[file:1][web:127][web:129]
special_rules.single_game_exception_rule: If a single game occurs during an otherwise light week, that week's load is capped at 160 plyos and 1000m sprint. Do NOT add to total; absorb within weekly band.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: No extra volume if sessions missed.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Tier 3 blocks commonly occur during AAU, summer league, or post-tournament windows. Can be 4–8 weeks depending on schedule. Maintain 6-week minimum for meaningful development.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 true sprint exposures/week at ≥90% Vmax. Can include tracked high-intensity from practice if available.[file:1]

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 absolute ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).[file:1]
✅ IN_SEASON_TIER_3 bands enforced (160–240 plyos, 1000–1600m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ Tier 3 (E3/E4) contacts limited to ≤40% per session but more generous than Tier 1/2 due to low game load.[file:1][web:129]
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY with intensity_percent_vmax enforced.[file:1]
✅ Fixture-dependent routing logic prevents misuse in high-game weeks.[web:127][web:128]
✅ Aligns with research supporting high-volume training in low-fixture windows (tapering, sparse schedules).[web:129][web:131]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, sport = BASKETBALL, season_type = IN_SEASON_TIER_3 (games_per_week ≤1), select SP_INSEASON_BBALL_13-17_6WK_TIER3_v1 as default.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.fixture_guard_responsibility: CRITICAL: Block Selector must verify games_per_week ≤1 before selecting Tier 3. If games spike mid-block, Weekly Accumulator or Gate Engine must trigger emergency downshift to Tier 1 or Tier 2 logic.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs Tier 3 band; allow ascent to 240 plyos and 1600m sprint only in truly light weeks. Flag any game/practice load that contradicts Tier 3 eligibility.[file:1][web:129]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Implement full development loading (similar to off-season) with basketball court-specific patterns: vertical jumps, max-V sprints, and COD drills.[web:127][web:128]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 3 and Week 6 gates to confirm load tolerance; route to Tier 1/2 if games resume or to Tier 3 repeat/extend if low-fixture window persists.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should clarify Tier 3 as the 'development in sparse fixture windows' strategy—common in summer leagues, post-tournament phases, and injury rehab contexts. Emphasize fixture dependency: Tier 3 ONLY if games ≤1/week.
integration_notes.integration_sequence: Block Selector (with fixture guard) → WEEKLY_ACCUMULATOR (with fixture monitor) → EXERCISE_SELECTION_ALGORITHM → GATE_ENGINE.

manifest_description: Multi-sport pre-season bridge block for Youth 13-17, 6 weeks. Converts off-season strength and power into sport-ready explosive movement and court/field speed while maintaining injury resilience. Agnostic to sport; routed via MDP bias (JUMP, SPEED, COD) for sport-specificity.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Bridge from off-season strength/power into sport-ready explosive movement, directional speed, and change-of-direction patterns.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Speed–strength and low-volume power (approach jumps, short accelerations, med ball throws)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Elastic vertical and lateral jumps (CMJ, low-amplitude bounds, lateral bounds)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z1: Max-velocity court/field sprints at varied angles (straight-line and curved runs)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Sport-relevant COD and footwork (shuffles, cuts, transitions)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Mixed-distance sprints (10m–60m) at ≥90% Vmax covering court/field patterns relevant to assigned sport. Distance: 600–800 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:136][web:139]

plyo_contact_range.note: Lower-to-middle PRE_SEASON band (120–180). Mix vertical, lateral, and COD-related landings. Tier 3 ≤40%.[file:1][web:140]

sprint_meters_range.note: Inside PRE_SEASON band (600–1000). TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY ≥90% Vmax.[file:1][web:138][web:143]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Strength + power emphasis (e.g., trap bar + box jumps, or sled push + vertical plyo).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Court/field speed and sport-specific COD + lighter strength.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High; converting strength into explosiveness. By Week 3, MDP bias is applied to fine-tune patterns.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 primary (box jumps, CMJ, lateral bounds); E3 (depth jumps) introduced cautiously late in Meso 1 for advanced athletes, within ≤40% Tier 3 rule.[file:1][web:142]
macro_structure.notes: Bias application (JUMP vs SPEED vs COD) occurs by Week 3: guards/perimeter get SPEED bias (max-V court runs); post/interior get JUMP bias (vertical); midfielders/defenders get COD bias (cuts, shuttles).[web:137]

macro_structure.primary_goal: Finalize sport-specific explosive and movement qualities; approach season-ready state without peaking too early.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Sport-specific power drills (e.g., approach jumps in basketball, directional accelerations in field sports)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Reactive/elastic jumps mirroring game demands (repeated CMJ, lateral hops, direction-change landings)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z1: Max-V sport-specific sprints (fast breaks, transition, recovery runs)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Game-speed COD and defensive footwork under fatigue

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Court/field-length and direction-change sprints at ≥90–100% Vmax mimicking in-game transitions. Distance: 700–1000 m/week true sprint meters.[file:1][web:140][web:141]

plyo_contact_range.note: Upper-middle PRE_SEASON band (120–180). Maintain quality; Tier 3 ≤40%.[file:1][web:138]

sprint_meters_range.note: Upper PRE_SEASON band (600–1000). Emphasis on high-velocity, directional complexity.[file:1][web:143]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Sport-biased power + strength maintenance (e.g., heavy trap bar + approach jumps for JUMP bias; short sprints + explosive core for SPEED bias).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Sport-specific movement and COD patterns + accessory work.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High early in Meso 2; trend toward moderate by Week 6 to avoid overreaching into season.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E3. More E3 usage (depth jumps, single-leg bounds) allowed in Week 5 for advanced athletes; scale back Week 6 to preserve freshness.[file:1][web:139][web:142]
macro_structure.notes: Meso 2 is the 'sport translation' phase: all work is now sport-specific. By Week 6, athlete should feel bouncy, quick, and sport-ready but not fatigued.

week_3.purpose: Lock in the secondary MDP bias (JUMP vs SPEED vs COD) for Weeks 4–6 based on sport, position, and athlete testing.
week_3.action_if_fail: Delay bias lock and reassess position/role; use generic multi-sport approach for Meso 2 if clarity lacking.
week_3.note: This gate is operational/strategic, not a readiness gate.

week_6.purpose: Verify readiness to enter sport-specific in-season block (Tier 1, 2, or 3 depending on fixture schedule).
week_6.action_if_fail: Route to 2–3 week mini-block to extend pre-season prep or identify injury/readiness issue before season.
week_6.action_if_pass: Advance to sport-specific IN_SEASON block (basketball, soccer, etc.).

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6. Athlete should feel explosive, quick, confident, and physically ready.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Deliver a well-prepared, sport-ready athlete to in-season maintenance or development block.

special_rules.tier3_fraction_rule: E3/E4 contacts ≤40% of plyo contacts per session; minimize in Weeks 4–6 to preserve freshness.[file:1]
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: No extra volume for missed sessions.
special_rules.mdp_bias_lock_rule: By end of Week 3, MDP bias (JUMP, SPEED, or COD) is locked; do not change during Meso 2.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Pre-season can be 4–8 weeks depending on sport calendar. This 6-week block can be repeated or shortened; maintain weekly band enforcement.
special_rules.sprint_session_rule: Maximum 3 true sprint exposures/week (≥90% Vmax), in line with Youth 13-17 sprint caps.[file:1]

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 13-17 ceilings respected (120 contacts/session, 240/week, 800m/session, 2000m/week).[file:1]
✅ PRE_SEASON bands enforced (120–180 plyos, 600–1000m sprint/week).[file:1]
✅ Tier 3 (E3/E4) capped at ≤40% of session contacts.[file:1]
✅ TRUE_SPRINT_METERS_ONLY with intensity_percent_vmax enforced.[file:1]
✅ MDP bias routing (JUMP, SPEED, COD) enables sport/position-specific application without creating separate blocks.[file:1][web:137]
✅ Structure aligns with pre-season periodization literature: high volume, mixed intensity, progressive sport-specificity.[web:136][web:140][web:142]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_13_17, season_type = PRE_SEASON, and sport is NOT basketball (or before basketball PRE_SEASON block is available), select SP_PRESEASON_MULTI_13-17_6WK_v1 as default multi-sport pre-season block.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.mdp_bias_routing_responsibility: At Week 3 gate, Exercise Selection Algorithm receives MDP bias (JUMP, SPEED, or COD) from coaching staff or auto-detect logic based on sport/position and locks it for Weeks 4–6. This drives exercise pool filtering and zone selection.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts and sprint_meters vs PRE_SEASON band; apply MDP bias filters to exercise candidates (e.g., JUMP bias = more vertical/unilateral jumps; SPEED bias = more linear sprint work).[file:1][web:137]
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Implement zone routing and exercise selection with MDP bias active. Ensure sport-relevant patterns (e.g., lateral bounds for COD, approach jumps for JUMP, extended sprints for SPEED).[web:138][web:140]
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Week 3 gate locks MDP bias; Week 6 gate checks readiness for sport-specific in-season.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should explain pre-season as the 'conversion phase': off-season strength becomes sport-ready explosiveness via MDP bias routing. Emphasize that one block covers all Youth 13-17 sports via bias mechanism, not separate blocks per sport.[web:136][web:142]
integration_notes.integration_sequence: Block Selector → (Week 3 Decision: MDP Bias Lock) → WEEKLY_ACCUMULATOR (with bias filters) → EXERCISE_SELECTION_ALGORITHM (with MDP routing) → GATE_ENGINE.

manifest_description: Pre-season fundamentals block for Youth 8-12, 6 weeks. Bridges off-season play/general athleticism into first competitive season with emphasis on movement literacy, coordination, balance, and FUN. Zero plyometric contacts; low-intensity, high-variety play-based structure.

blocks.fixture_context_description: Introductory competitive season; first or early organized sport; emphasis on enjoying movement and sport participation.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Introduce fundamental movement patterns (running, jumping, catching, balance) through games and play. Build coordination, body awareness, and excitement for sports.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Balance, coordination, and footwork via games (tag, hopscotch, ladder drills, movement games)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z6: Light bodyweight movement exploration (crawling, animal walks, simple stretches, balance activities)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: No prescribed high-velocity sprints. Movement is playful and self-paced. Any running is game-based (tag, relay races) at child's natural speed, not timed or measured.[file:1][web:145][web:146]
