plyo_contact_range.note: ZERO plyometric contacts. Jumping is natural/play-based only (e.g., jump rope, hopscotch), not structured or counted.[file:1][web:147]

sprint_meters_range.note: No sprint meter counting. Movement is unstructured and play-driven.[file:1][web:148]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Movement discovery games + dynamic play (tag, Simon Says, movement relays, balance games).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Variety games: different sports/movement types each week (soccer footwork, basketball basics, tennis swings, baseball throwing).

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: LOW; focus is on fun, engagement, and variety. No fatigue accumulation intended.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: NONE. No plyometric training. Natural jumping/hopping via play only.[file:1][web:149]
macro_structure.notes: Sessions should feel like recess, not training. Coach as a facilitator/game leader, not an instructor. 50+ minutes of play/movement with minimal standing around.[web:145][web:151]

macro_structure.primary_goal: Introduce sport-specific foundational skills (shooting, throwing, kicking, catching) in game context. Build confidence, team identity, and anticipation for first competitive season.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Sport-specific footwork and coordination (dribbling drills, cutting practice, base running, ground balls)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z6: Light, game-based movement with equipment (ball handling, throwing form, balance work)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: No prescribed intense sprints. Movement remains play-based and natural. Scrimmage-style games may include casual running, but no timing/measurement.[file:1][web:150]

plyo_contact_range.note: ZERO plyometric contacts. All jumping is incidental to play, never structured.[file:1]

sprint_meters_range.note: No sprint meter tracking. Movement remains unstructured.[file:1]

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Sport-specific intro game (e.g., basketball shooting basics, soccer small-sided match, baseball hitting practice).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Different sport intro or fun movement variety (e.g., relay races, obstacle courses, multi-sport games).

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: LOW; building excitement and competence without pressure or intensity.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: NONE. No plyometric training.[file:1]
macro_structure.notes: Transition from pure movement discovery into sport-specific excitement. Session structure should remain playful; no repetitive drills without game context. Coach emphasizes enjoyment, teamwork, and trying new things over perfection.

week_3.purpose: Verify that child is having fun, comfortable with coach/environment, and developing basic movement literacy without injury or anxiety.
week_3.action_if_fail: Shift to even more play-based, less structured approach; check for external stressors (pressure from parents, etc.); adjust session style.
week_3.note: This is a qualitative gate, not a performance gate.

week_6.purpose: Confirm child is ready and excited to begin competitive play. Check that foundational patterns (run, catch, throw, kick) are at 'good enough' level.
week_6.action_if_fail: Consider extending pre-season by 2–3 weeks; investigate barriers (anxiety, overprotective coaching, skill gap); do NOT rush into competition.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 6. Child should feel excited, confident, and ready for their first competitive matches/games.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Provide a joyful, movement-literate young athlete ready to participate in first competitive season with confidence and enthusiasm.

special_rules.zero_plyometrics_rule: NO structured plyometric exercises, period. Jumping is only incidental to play and games. Enforce this strictly.[file:1]
special_rules.no_intensity_measurement_rule: No timing, no max-effort tests, no 'fastest' rankings. All movement is self-paced and play-based.
special_rules.play_based_requirement: Minimum 80% of each session must be games or play; no more than 20% 'drills.' Coach as facilitator, not instructor.[web:145][web:151]
special_rules.variety_requirement: Expose child to 3+ different sports/movement types across the 6-week block. Prevent early specialization and burnout.
special_rules.parental_communication_rule: Communicate to parents that this block is about FUN and movement literacy, NOT performance outcomes. Actively discourage pressure or intensity from home.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Do not make up missed sessions. Consistency is nice, but forcing attendance goes against the 'fun-first' philosophy.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Pre-season can be 4–8 weeks; this 6-week block can be shortened to 4 weeks or extended to 8 depending on season start date.

governance_checklist: ✅ Youth 8-12 pre-season population ceiling respected (ZERO plyos, LOW CNS, PLAY-BASED).[file:1]
✅ Zero plyometric contacts enforced (no structured jumps).[file:1]
✅ No intense sprint work or max-velocity training.[file:1]
✅ Play-based, child-centered structure (80%+ games/play).[web:145][web:151]
✅ Movement literacy and coordination emphasis (no strength/power).[web:146][web:147]
✅ Engagement and enjoyment as primary success metrics, not performance.[web:148][web:150]

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When service_line = SP_Performance, population = Youth_8_12, season_type = PRE_SEASON, and this is child's first or early organized season, select SP_PRESEASON_MULTI_8-12_6WK_FUN_v1 as default.[file:1][file:2]
integration_notes.coaching_staff_responsibility: Structure sessions as games and play, NOT drills or intense training. Emphasize coach as facilitator/game leader role. Monitor child enjoyment and confidence actively; report concerns to service coordinator.
integration_notes.zero_plyometric_enforcement: CRITICAL: No structured jumping exercises, depth jumps, or plyometric drills. Jumping is only incidental to natural play.[file:1][web:145]
integration_notes.engagement_monitoring: Track child's session attendance, reported enjoyment, and comfort level. Use qualitative feedback, not performance metrics.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 3 and Week 6 gates to confirm engagement and readiness for competitive season; route to in-season or extend pre-season based on qualitative assessment.
integration_notes.parental_communication_responsibility: Educate parents that this phase is about movement discovery and sport enjoyment, NOT performance or competition. Discourage pressure or intensity from home.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Playbook should emphasize Youth 8-12 pre-season as a PLAY-BASED DISCOVERY phase. Contrast sharply with Youth 13-17 periodized training. Key message: 'First season = fun. Development comes naturally through play.'[web:145][web:147][web:151]
integration_notes.integration_sequence: Block Selector → COACHING_STAFF (with play-based mandate) → GATE_ENGINE (qualitative gates only).

manifest_description: Return-to-Performance ACL Stage 1 meso-macro manifest. Early Recovery / Tissue Protection block. No plyometrics, no sprinting. Pain and tissue tolerance gates drive progression.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Protect graft and surrounding tissues, restore basic ROM, and build positional strength without plyometric or ballistic load.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z6: Hypertrophy-like time-under-tension at very low load
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Skill/mobility for gait and joint positioning

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: No sprinting. Walking and basic gait drills may occur but do not count as sprint work.

plyo_contact_range.note: Stage 1 forbids plyometrics. Any elastic landing work is a protocol violation.

sprint_meters_range.note: No sprint or running volume is tracked in Stage 1.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Controlled ROM, isometric holds, basic bilateral strength under strict pain and swelling rules.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Similar profile with emphasis on movement quality, swelling check, and confidence under low load.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Low CNS demand across all weeks; priority is tissue status, pain, and swelling, not progression of load.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E0 only. No E1–E4. Any exercise flagged as plyometric in the library is forbidden in this stage.
macro_structure.notes: All progression decisions depend on pain 0–2/10 during and 24h post, and swelling behavior.

week_2.purpose: Confirm that early loading and ROM work are tolerated without pain >2/10 or swelling increase.
week_2.action_if_fail: Hold progression, maintain or regress exercise difficulty, and extend Stage 1 by 1–2 weeks. Consider medical consult.
week_2.action_if_pass: Allow gradual progression of Band 0 load (more time under tension, small ROM increases) while staying within Stage 1 boundaries.

week_4.purpose: Decide if athlete is ready to transition to Stage 2 Initial Loading Bilateral Foundation.
week_4.action_if_fail: Extend Stage 1 by 1–2 weeks and/or adjust exercise selection. Do not introduce plyometric or unilateral dynamic loading.

exit_state.exit_assessment: Conducted at or after Week 4. Athlete must demonstrate consistent tolerance to Stage 1 exercises without adverse response.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Athlete leaves Stage 1 with tissue calm, ROM restored to protocol targets, and confidence in basic positions, ready for bilateral loading in Stage 2.

special_rules.no_plyo_rule: All plyometric exercises (any E1–E4, is_plyometric = true) are forbidden in Stage 1. Violation is a hard stop.
special_rules.no_sprint_rule: No true sprint work. Gait drills and walking drills are allowed but are not tracked as sprint meters.
special_rules.pain_gate_rule: If pain >2/10 during or 24h after session, regress exercise pattern or intensity and do not progress stage.
special_rules.swelling_rule: Any increase in joint swelling triggers regression and/or medical review before further loading.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed session = skipped stimulus. Do not compress or add extra volume on later days.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Maintain stage intent and progression criteria even if calendar weeks shift. Do not shorten Stage 1 below minimum duration without medical directive.

governance_checklist: ✅ Stage 1 contact cap per session = 0; no plyometrics allowed.
✅ E-node limited to E0 only; E1–E4 forbidden.
✅ No sprint meters or COD work; TRUESPRINT_METERS standard disabled for this stage.
✅ Band 0 only; no higher strength bands used.
✅ Pain and swelling gates aligned with R2P Stage 1 in Load Standards.
✅ Exit explicitly routes to Stage 2 block and does not skip stages.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When r2p_stage = R2P_Stage_1 and ACL injury flag is active, select R2P_ACL_STAGE1_EARLY_RECOVERY_4WK_v1 unless medical notes specify otherwise.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Confirm that plyo_contacts and sprint_meters remain at 0. Any non-zero detected is flagged as a violation.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Filter exercise pools to NON_IMPACT_LANDING, ISOMETRIC_HOLDS, CONTROLLED_ROM only. Reject any candidate tagged as plyometric or sprint.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Evaluate mid-stage and stage-advance gates based on pain, swelling, ROM, and control. Do not advance to Stage 2 without explicit pass.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should explain that Stage 1 is about calm tissue, ROM, and positional control. No plyos, no sprinting, and no chasing numbers.

manifest_description: Return-to-Performance ACL Stage 2 meso-macro manifest. Initial Loading / Bilateral Foundation. Introduces low-level bilateral plyometric exposure within strict contact, pain, and swelling limits.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Introduce low-level bilateral plyometric exposure and controlled loading while protecting the graft. Build confidence in landing and basic deceleration.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z5: Strength-endurance (tempo squats, split-stance hinges at Band 0–1)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Intro elastic (E1-only low-amplitude bilateral hops and landings)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: No sprinting or COD. Forward/backward movement is limited to controlled step and gait drills, not tracked as sprint meters.

plyo_contact_range.note: Contacts/session, not per week. Total must not exceed 40. All contacts are bilateral, low amplitude, E1 only.

sprint_meters_range.note: No running or sprint volume tracked in Stage 2.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Bilateral strength (Band 0–1), basic bilateral landings, positional decel.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Similar structure with emphasis on pattern repetition and pain/symmetry monitoring.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Low CNS; emphasis on quality, symmetry, and tissue response.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E0 for strength and ROM, E1 for low-intensity bilateral hops and controlled landings. No E2–E4. Plyo is always low-amplitude, with full control on take-off and landing.
macro_structure.notes: Contact target should often sit near 20–30 for quality; 40 is a ceiling, not a goal.

week_2.purpose: Confirm that bilateral loading and low-level plyometrics are tolerated without pain >2/10 or swelling.
week_2.action_if_fail: Reduce contact target to 10–20 per session and lower strength load (Band 0 focus). Extend Stage 2 by 1–2 weeks and consider medical consult.
week_2.action_if_pass: Allow staying near 20–30 contacts/session with Band 1 strength work while maintaining pain/swelling discipline.

week_4.purpose: Decide if athlete can progress to Stage 3 (unilateral integration and higher-intensity decel).
week_4.action_if_fail: Extend Stage 2 and refine bilateral patterns. Do not introduce unilateral plyometrics or cutting.

exit_state.exit_assessment: End of Week 4 or later. Athlete must handle bilateral loading and 20–40 low-level contacts without adverse tissue response.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Athlete leaves Stage 2 with proven tolerance to bilateral loading and basic landing mechanics, ready to add unilateral work and more demanding decel in Stage 3.

special_rules.plyo_scope_rule: All plyometric work must be bilateral, low amplitude, E1 only. Any unilateral or reactive jumps are forbidden in Stage 2.
special_rules.no_sprint_rule: No sprinting or high-speed COD. Only controlled walking/jogging drills if cleared, but not counted as sprint volume.
special_rules.pain_gate_rule: If pain exceeds 2/10 during or 24h after, reduce load and contacts, and hold progression.
special_rules.swelling_rule: Any increase in swelling halts plyometric exposure until resolved and may trigger regression to Stage 1.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed sessions are not made up by increasing contacts later. Maintain caps to protect tissue.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Stage 2 minimum duration is 3–4 weeks. Do not shorten below 3 weeks without medical sign-off, even if calendar shifts.

governance_checklist: ✅ Stage 2 contact cap per session = 40, aligned with R2P Stage 2 spec.
✅ E-node limited to E0–E1 only; no E2–E4.
✅ No sprint meters or COD; TRUESPRINT_METERS standard disabled.
✅ Band 1 maximum; no higher strength bands.
✅ Pain and swelling gates explicit, with mid-stage and exit checks.
✅ Exit routes cleanly into Stage 3 (progressive unilateral loading).

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When r2p_stage = R2P_Stage_2 and prior block exit_state.ready_for_block = 'R2P_ACL_STAGE2_INITIAL_LOADING_4WK_v1', select this block. Do not skip Stage 2.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Confirm plyo_contacts/session ≤40 and plyo_contacts/week ≤80. Any positive sprint_meters flagged as violation.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Filter for BILATERAL_LOW_AMPLITUDE, CONTROLLED_LANDINGS, LIGHT_HOPS only. Reject unilateral plyos, high-amplitude jumps, and any sprint-tagged exercises.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: At Week 2 and Week 4, check pain, swelling, bilateral control, and landing quality to decide whether to progress, hold, or regress.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should explain Stage 2 as the first step into controlled plyometrics: all bilateral, low-amplitude, with contacts treated as ceilings, not goals.
integration_notes.future_versioning: Next blocks in chain: R2P_ACL_STAGE3_PROGRESSIVE_LOADING_4WK_v1 (unilateral integration) and R2P_ACL_STAGE4_RETURN_TO_SPORT_4WK_v1.

manifest_description: Return-to-Performance ACL Stage 3 meso-macro manifest. Progressive Loading / Unilateral Integration. Introduces unilateral plyometrics, directional bounds, and sport-movement prep under strict pain and swelling control.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Integrate unilateral loading and moderate-intensity plyometrics to prepare for sport-specific demands while maintaining pain and swelling control.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Speed–Strength / elastic (E1–E2 unilateral hops, bounds, decel drills)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: Higher-velocity elastic elements without max shock (no depth-jump style E3 unless approved)

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: No true sprint or high-speed COD volume tracked. Accel-to-stick and linear decel drills are treated as plyometric/decel work, not sprint meters.

plyo_contact_range.note: Operate mostly in the 30–50 contact range; 60–80 is reserved for later in the stage if tolerated. Unilateral work counted with ONE_FOOT_CONTACT standard.

sprint_meters_range.note: Linear accel-to-stick drills are counted as contacts, not sprint meters, in Stage 3.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Primary strength + unilateral integration (SL RDL, split squat ISO, unilateral decel).
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Supportive strength and lower-contact decel/plyo work with emphasis on quality.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: Moderate CNS load overall, with increasing unilateral and multi-planar demands.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: E1–E2 allowed. Begin with mostly E1 and add E2 (directional bounds, higher step-downs) as tolerance proves. E3 only via explicit director override and not required by this block.
macro_structure.notes: Progression is driven by movement quality, pain 0–2/10, and 24h swelling. Contacts remain well below 80 unless tissue response is excellent.

week_2.purpose: Confirm that unilateral loading and directional bounds are tolerated without pain >2/10, swelling increase, or valgus deterioration.
week_2.action_if_fail: Reduce unilateral plyo volume (e.g., 20–30 contacts/session), bias back toward bilateral loading, and extend Stage 3 by 1–2 weeks.
week_2.action_if_pass: Allow progression toward 40–50 contacts/session, with more E2-style bounds and decel drills as long as form and tissue response hold.

week_4.purpose: Decide if athlete is ready to enter Stage 4 Return-to-Sport integration with higher decel and sport-specific loading.
week_4.action_if_fail: Extend Stage 3 to continue unilateral control development. Do not introduce cutting or high-speed reactive COD.

exit_state.exit_assessment: Performed at or after Week 4. Athlete must show stable tolerance to unilateral and directional loading without adverse response.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Athlete exits Stage 3 with robust unilateral control and decel readiness, prepared for more advanced sport-specific and reactive tasks in Stage 4.

special_rules.plyo_scope_rule: Unilateral plyometrics and directional bounds allowed at E1–E2 intensity only. No depth jumps, no max-effort single-leg bounds, no reactive contacts.
special_rules.no_sprint_rule: No full-speed sprinting or high-speed COD yet. Linear accel-to-stick and controlled decel drills are allowed within plyo contact caps.
special_rules.pain_gate_rule: If pain exceeds 2/10 during or 24h post-session, reduce load and contacts and halt progression.
special_rules.swelling_rule: Any recurrent or increasing swelling triggers regression in plyo intensity/volume and may require partial return to Stage 2 patterns.
special_rules.valgus_monitoring_rule: Frontal-plane knee alignment monitored on all unilateral and lateral decel tasks. Significant valgus drift triggers regression and technique focus.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Missed sessions are not compensated with higher-contact days. Respect per-session and per-week caps.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Minimum Stage 3 duration is 4 weeks unless medical team approves earlier transition based on objective tests.

governance_checklist: ✅ Stage 3 contact cap per session = 80, consistent with R2P Stage 3 spec.
✅ E-node limited to E0–E2; E3 conditional only with director override, E4 forbidden.
✅ No sprint meters tracked; decel/accel drills treated as plyometric contacts.
✅ Band 2 maximum; no heavier strength bands used.
✅ Pain, swelling, unilateral control, and valgus behavior embedded in gates.
✅ Exit routes cleanly into Stage 4 Return-to-Sport block.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When r2p_stage = R2P_Stage_3 and prior block exit_state.ready_for_block = 'R2P_ACL_STAGE3_PROGRESSIVE_LOADING_4WK_v1', select this block. Do not skip from Stage 2 directly to Stage 4.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Track plyo_contacts per session and per week, ensuring they remain ≤80/session and ≤160/week. Confirm sprint_meters remains 0.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Select from UNILATERAL_MODERATE, DIRECTIONAL_BOUNDS, SPORT_MOVEMENT_PREP categories with E1–E2 intensity. Reject depth jumps, max-effort plyos, cutting, or any sprint-tagged work.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 2 and Week 4 gates to regulate progression and decide when athlete is ready to move to Stage 4.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should clarify that Stage 3 is where unilateral and directional plyos become main characters, but sprinting and cutting are still out of scope.
integration_notes.future_versioning: Next block: R2P_ACL_STAGE4_RETURN_TO_SPORT_4WK_v1, which introduces more advanced decel, tri-planar work, and early return-to-sport testing.

manifest_description: Return-to-Performance ACL Stage 4 meso-macro manifest. Return to Sport / Full Integration. High-level deceleration, tri-planar plyometrics, and on-court/field preparation leading into full sport return.

macro_structure.primary_goal: Blend high-level strength, tri-planar plyometrics, and sport-specific footwork to bridge from rehab to full training and non-restricted practice.

fv_zone_emphasis.Z3: Speed–Strength for powerful decel and re-accel
fv_zone_emphasis.Z4: High-intensity elastic and advanced plyos (E3–E4 with monitoring)
fv_zone_emphasis.Z8: Sport-specific COD, agility, and reactive drills

macro_structure.sprint_intent_description: Short, high-quality accelerations and COD are embedded as sport movement drills and counted as plyometric/skill work, not sprint meters, inside R2P. True sprint budgeting resumes after graduation into SP Performance or team programs.

plyo_contact_range.note: Operate mostly in the 60–100 contact range; 120 is an absolute ceiling for this population and stage, not a target. ONE_FOOT_CONTACT standard applies.

sprint_meters_range.note: R2P Stage 4 still tracks decel/COD work as contacts, not weekly sprint meters.

cns_per_day.day_A_description: Heavier strength (up to Band 3) plus higher-intensity plyos and COD work.
cns_per_day.day_B_description: Supportive strength, lower-contact elastic work, and technical sport-pattern practice.

macro_structure.cns_weekly_intent: High but controlled; designed as a bridge into full sport, not an endless peak.
macro_structure.elastic_strategy: Full spectrum E1–E3, with selective E4 under close monitoring. Depth jumps, reactive single-leg work, and high-demand COD are introduced gradually, not all at once.
macro_structure.notes: Progress volume and intensity only when pain and swelling remain stable and movement quality stays high, especially under fatigue and reaction.

week_2.purpose: Check early response to higher-intensity plyos and sport patterns before progressing complexity and reactive demands.
week_2.action_if_fail: Hold or reduce complexity (less E3/E4, fewer reactive drills), lower contacts toward 40–60/session, and extend Stage 4 timeline.
week_2.action_if_pass: Progress toward more complex COD, reactive drills, and modest increases in E3/E4 volume while maintaining technique and tissue response.

week_4.purpose: Decide if athlete meets Return-to-Sport criteria and can graduate from R2P into full training and competitive preparation environments.
week_4.action_if_fail: Maintain or slightly regress Stage 4 loading while addressing specific deficits (strength asymmetry, hop symmetry, confidence). Re-test after an additional 2–4 weeks.
week_4.action_if_pass: Graduate to SP Performance or relevant sport performance programming, with clear communication of any ongoing guardrails.

exit_state.exit_assessment: Performed at or after Week 4, often aligned with formal RTS test day. All key metrics (clinical and performance) must meet the agreed thresholds.
exit_state.handoff_intent: Athlete exits R2P and enters regular SP Performance or team training where standard Load Standards population and season rules apply.

special_rules.e4_monitoring_rule: E4 (maximum-intensity) plyos are allowed but must be tightly monitored and used sparingly, especially early in Stage 4.
special_rules.cutting_progression_rule: Cutting and reactive COD start with controlled angles and build toward more chaotic and game-like demands only after mid-stage gate is passed.
special_rules.pain_gate_rule: Pain >2/10 during or 24h after high-intensity work triggers regression in intensity/volume and may delay RTS testing.
special_rules.swelling_rule: Any meaningful swelling response pauses E3/E4 and cutting work until resolved and re-cleared.
special_rules.no_makeup_rule: Do not compensate missed sessions by exceeding per-session caps or by stacking high-CNS days.
special_rules.calendar_shift_rule: Stage 4 typical duration is 2–4 weeks before full return. Extending for more time is allowed; compressing below 2 weeks requires explicit medical and coaching sign-off.

governance_checklist: ✅ Stage 4 contact cap per session = 120, matching R2P Stage 4 spec.
✅ E-node permissions allow E0–E4, with E4 allowed only with monitoring.
✅ Band 3 maximum, consistent with Stage 4 R2P rules.
✅ Pain, swelling, hop symmetry, and confidence built into mid-stage and RTS gates.
✅ Exit requires formal RTS test pass and medical clearance before graduation.

integration_notes.block_selector_responsibility: When r2p_stage = R2P_Stage_4 and prior block exit_state.ready_for_block = 'R2P_ACL_STAGE4_RETURN_TO_SPORT_4WK_v1', select this block as the terminal R2P block. No R2P stage beyond 4.
integration_notes.weekly_accumulator_responsibility: Ensure plyo_contacts/session ≤120 and plyo_contacts/week ≤240. Sprint meters remain 0 inside R2P; true sprint budgeting resumes post-graduation.
integration_notes.exercise_selection_algorithm_responsibil: Open full catalog but enforce population-specific ceilings and supervision requirements for E4 and Band 3 work.
integration_notes.gate_engine_responsibility: Use Week 2 and Week 4 gates to modulate intensity and determine RTS readiness. Do not mark RTS passed without both test battery and medical clearance fields true.
integration_notes.ai_playbook_reference: Coach & AI Playbook should describe Stage 4 as the final bridge from rehab to normal sport training, emphasizing that passing RTS tests and medical clearance—not just feeling good—govern graduation.
integration_notes.future_versioning: After Stage 4, athlete transitions to standard SP Performance or sport-specific blocks governed by population (Youth_13_17 or Adult) and season_type, not by R2P stage.
